A company is planning a Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management implementation. The existing system will be shut down after go-live of the new enterprise resource planning (ERP) system.

The company requires that all transactional and master data from the existing ERP be stored in a single location.

The company also requires that the master data connect to Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management for updates throughout the lifecycle of the implementation and at go-live.

You need to determine which tool meets the requirements.

Which tool should you select?

discussion.content:
For the companyâ€™s requirements of storing all transactional and master data from the existing ERP in a single location and ensuring that the master data connects to Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management for updates throughout the lifecycle of the implementation and at go-live, the tool that meets these requirements is Lifecycle Services (LCS).

Lifecycle Services is designed to manage the migration of data from legacy systems to Dynamics 365, including both transactional and master data. It provides a comprehensive solution for data migration, transformation, and integration, which is essential for a smooth transition to the new ERP system1.

Therefore, the correct answer is: E. Lifecycle Services (LCS)
